qas.question: What bodies were intended to be replaced by the popular militia created in 1988?
What chemical weapon did Libya start making in 1987?
Where did Libya manufacture mustard gas?
Where did an abortive coup occur in 1993?
Where did a Muslim insurgency take place in 1995?

context: In the aftermath of the 1986 U.S. attack, the army was purged of perceived disloyal elements, and in 1988, Gaddafi announced the creation of a popular militia to replace the <a0_0>army and police<a0_0/>. In 1987, Libya began production of <a1_0>mustard gas<a1_0/> at a facility in <a2_0>Rabta<a2_0/>, although publicly denying it was stockpiling chemical weapons, and unsuccessfully attempted to develop nuclear weapons. The period also saw a growth in domestic Islamist opposition, formulated into groups like the Muslim Brotherhood and the Libyan Islamic Fighting Group. A number of assassination attempts against Gaddafi were foiled, and in turn, 1989 saw the security forces raid mosques believed to be centres of counter-revolutionary preaching. In October 1993, elements of the increasingly marginalised army initiated a failed coup in <a3_0>Misrata<a3_0/>, while in September 1995, Islamists launched an insurgency in <a4_0>Benghazi<a4_0/>, and in July 1996 an anti-Gaddafist football riot broke out in Tripoli. The Revolutionary Committees experienced a resurgence to combat these Islamists.
